channel.title: Counter
channel.description: Hi, I was wondering what the code would be to make a timer. Like I made a thing where if someone opens this chest they teleport to jail BUT hoq do I make it so after 60seconds they teleport back to home. And if possible make the timer show up in corner of screen. Thanks[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 08, 2008, 07:52:50 pm[/size][hr]Anyone, Please?

item.title: Counter
item.dc:creator: @Project_Evolution Project Evolution
item.description:
@Project_Evolution wrote:

slomifier:

How is that different then mine? The only difference is where you declared the variable, idiot.

Another difference is that it lags like SHIT because every second your server is running that variable. Also adding the method to public boolean PROCESS() adds more lag because its being called every 500ms.

Read full topic

fine you can do VAR NAME += 1;

And, I’ll admit I forgot the catch that prevents it from going under 0;

Whats that then:

and press ctrl+f and search:

Code:

public boolean process()

then when you get to it, right under it put:

Again, your being hypocritical

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: Counter
item.dc:creator: @slomifier slomifier
item.description:
@slomifier wrote:

Oh thats easy. Find your public boolean, (should say that it’s called every 500ms after it)

and above it add:

public int VAR NAME = DEFAULT TIMER VALUE;

and under the public boolean, add:

VAR NAME -= 1;

now, every second, the variable will reduce by 2. (1 every half second).

Or you could try this: (I havn’t tested it, so IDK if it works)

Find your public boolean, (should say that it’s called every 500ms after it)

and above it add:

public double VAR NAME = DEFAULT TIMER VALUE;

and under the public boolean, add:

VAR NAME -= 0.5;

Now it will go down once a second, little easier to deal with.

and remember, if I put it in capitals, you have to change it to what you want. Change VAR NAME to the variable name, and DEFAULT TIMER VALUE to what you want the variable’s value to start with.

Read full topic
